choices.text:
Put together a healthy meal plan for me for seven days.  My restrictions are dairy, garlic, honey, almonds, pistachios, and cashews
Here's a balanced, nutritious meal plan tailored to your dietary restrictions that includes breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snack options for seven days. Remember to adjust portion sizes based on your individual needs.

Monday:
Breakfast: Overnight oats with almond milk, chia seeds, and mixed berries
Lunch: Grilled vegetable wrap with avocado spread (made without garlic or honey)
Dinner: Baked salmon with quinoa and steamed green beans
Snack 1: Sliced cucumber with hummus (make sure it's dairy-free and doesn't contain almonds, pistachios, or cashews)
Snack 2: Roasted chickpeas seasoned with salt, pepper, and dried herbs
Tuesday:
Breakfast: Smoothie made with spinach, banana, dairy-free milk (such as oat or soy), and a touch of natural sweetener like stevia
Lunch: Lentil soup with whole grain bread
Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers with quinoa, black beans, and avocado
Snack 1: Roasted nuts (such as sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds) without added honey or salt
Snack 2: Sliced apple with natural almond butter (make sure it's dairy-free)
Wednesday:
Breakfast: Protein-packed chia pudding made with unsweetened coconut milk and topped with fresh fruit
Lunch: Chickpea salad with mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, and a lemon herb dressing (made without honey)
Dinner: Grilled tofu or tempeh with roasted vegetables and brown rice
Snack 1: Sliced oranges with a sprinkle of natural coconut flakes
Snack 2: Roasted pumpkin seeds seasoned with sea salt
Thursday:
Breakfast: Gluten-free oatmeal with dairy-free milk, topped with sliced strawberries and a drizzle of natural honey substitute (such as maple syrup)
Lunch: Quinoa and black bean bowl with avocado, cilantro, and lime
Dinner: Baked cod with steamed green beans and wild rice
Snack 1: Roasted seaweed snacks without added salt or sugar
Snack 2: Sliced kiwi with a sprinkle of natural pistachio kernels (make sure they're dairy-free)
Friday:
Breakfast: Protein-packed green smoothie made with spinach, banana, unsweetened almond milk, and a scoop of dairy-free protein powder
Lunch: Lentil or vegetable stir-fry over brown rice
Dinner: Grilled portobello mushrooms with mixed greens and balsamic vinaigrette (made without honey)
Snack 1: Roasted chickpeas seasoned with smoked paprika, cumin, and sea salt
Snack 2: Sliced pear with a dollop of natural cashew butter (make sure it's dairy-free)
Saturday:
Breakfast: Chia seed pudding made with coconut milk, topped with fresh berries and a drizzle of maple syrup substitute
Lunch: Whole grain wrap filled with roasted vegetables, avocado, and hummus (make sure it's dairy-free and doesn't contain added honey)
Dinner: Grilled shrimp skewers with cauliflower rice and steamed broccoli
Snack 1: Sliced cucumber with a sprinkle of natural sunflower seed kernels
Snack 2: Roasted mixed nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, and cashews) without added salt or honey
